title: Evaluating Machine Translation for Multilingual Bug Reports
author: Avinash Patil (Juniper Networks Inc.), Aryan Jadon (Juniper Networks Inc.)
relevance_why: The study evaluates the performance of different machine translation systems, which could inform future audio-related language translation tasks by providing insights on effective translation methodologies and tools that might be adapted for audio and speech processing.
background: The study focuses on translating bug reports from multiple languages to English in the software development context, highlighting the challenges of technical jargon and domain-specific terminology in machine translation.
contribution: This research introduces a comprehensive evaluation framework for machine translation systems to tackle multilingual bug reports, achieving insights into their translation quality and effectiveness.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods lacked systematic evaluations against specialized technical texts, limiting their applicability in software engineering.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work evaluates multiple machine translation systems using diverse automatic metrics, providing a detailed comparative analysis in a targeted domain.

key_innovation: Establishes a framework for evaluating machine translation quality in the context of software engineering, emphasizing the need for domain adaptation.
real_world_impact: The findings can lead to improved collaboration in global software development by enhancing the accuracy of translations in bug-triaging workflows, potentially increasing efficiency in issue resolution.
limitations: The research is limited to bug reports from a single project, which may not generalize to other software systems or contexts.

new_terms.machine translation (MT): **Machine translation (MT)** refers to the automated process of translating text or speech from one language to another using computer software.
new_terms.bug reports: **Bug reports** are documents that describe defects or issues in a software application, usually submitted by users or developers, which require resolution.

open_sourcing: The code and dataset for this study are available at GitHub [https://github.com/av9ash/gitbugs/tree/main/multilingual](https://github.com/av9ash/gitbugs/tree/main/multilingual).
